Instruction: In a bowl, mix together ground lamb, cooked rice, salt, garam masala, and ground black pepper. Pour the mixture into a food processor and pulse 1 to 2 times until combined. Fold dill into the mixture.
Form the mixture into 10 meatballs, each approximately 2 inches in diameter.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add meatballs and cook until browned on all sides, about 6 to 8 minutes.
Remove meatballs from the skillet and set aside. Pour the tomato sauce into the skillet, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom.
You can replace lamb with mutton or beef.
You can replace dill with fresh cilantro.
These meatballs are typically fried, but grilling is also an option.
